data.title: Mary Renault
data.text:
AKA Eileen Mary Challans

Born: 4-Sep-1905

Birthplace: London, England

Died: 13-Dec-1983

Location of death: Cape Town, South Africa

Cause of death: unspecified

Gender: Female

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Lesbian

Occupation: Novelist

Nationality: South Africa

Executive summary: The Last of the Wine

Father: Frank Challans (physician)

Mother: Clementine Newsome Baxter

Sister: Joyce

Girlfriend: Julie Mullard (life-long companion)

High School: Clifton Girls School, Bristol, England

University: BA, St. Hugh's College, Oxford University (1928)

Medical School: Radcliffe Infirmary, Oxford University

Author of books:

Purposes of Love (1939, novel)

Kind Are Her Answers (1940, novel)

The Friendly Young Ladies (1945, novel)

Return to Night (1947, novel)

North Face (1948, novel)

The Charioteer (1953, novel)

The Last of the Wine (1956, novel)

The King Must Die (1958, novel)

The Bull from the Sea (1962, novel)

Lion in the Gateway (1964, novel)

The Mask of Apollo (1966, novel)

Fire from Heaven (1970, novel)

The Persian Boy (1972, novel)

The Nature of Alexander (1975, biography)

The Praise Singer (1978, novel)

Funeral Games (1981, novel)

Do you know something we don't?

Submit a correction or make a comment about this profile
